programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Euclid Alternative: When Leonard can't drive Sheldon to and from work, the friends stage an intervention to overcome Sheldon's fear of getting behind the wheel.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cooper-Nowitzki Theorem: Sheldon's friends are mystified when a younger student is attracted to him, but her intense devotion soon becomes too much to bear.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Panty Piñata Polarization: Sheldon bans Penny from the flat for numerous minor infractions, so she retaliates. Howard and Raj search for the America's Next Top Model house.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: From Mo Gilligan to Joanna Lumley, what do Britain's favourite famous faces think of The Greatest Auction, Our Planet, Countdown, M3GAN, and Siren: Survive the Island?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch Michael McIntyre's The Wheel, Love Is Blind, Strictly Come Dancing, Boiling Point, HELP! My House Is Haunted, and All Creatures Great and Small.

programme.title: Everybody's Talking About Jamie

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: (2011) Family comedy. Jim Carrey stars as a work-obsessed New York property developer whose life is turned upside down when he receives a crate containing six live penguins.

programme.title: The Land that Time Forgot
programme.desc: (1974) Fantasy adventure about survivors from a torpedoed First World War ship who end up in a legendary land in the Atlantic where dinosaurs roam. With Doug McClure.

programme.title: Secret Headquarters
programme.desc: (2022) Family comedy with Michael Peña. A young lad discovers that his lax dad is in fact a superhero. Then, with no time to process, he must foil a villain's plot to bring his daddy down.

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.desc: (2015) Part five of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The secret agents must bring down a terrorist group, but that's not easy when the CIA are hunting you down...

programme.title: Sicario 2: Soldado
programme.desc: (2018) Action sequel with Benicio Del Toro and Josh Brolin. Two operatives must create a gang war to stop Mexican drug cartels smuggling terrorists into the US.

programme.title: The Guard
programme.desc: (2011) Comedy crime thriller starring Brendan Gleeson and Don Cheadle. A dead body and an FBI agent disrupt a rule-bending policeman's laid-back life on the west coast of Ireland.

programme.title: Rango
programme.desc: (2011) Animated Wild West comedy with Johnny Depp. A pet chameleon accidentally becomes the sheriff of small frontier town, Dirt. Can he defend it? Oh, and he's got a mate called Roadkill.

programme.title: Stormbreaker
programme.desc: (2006) Family action-thriller. British intelligence recruit a schoolboy (Alex Pettyfer) to take on the man (Mickey Rourke) who killed his father and who threatens to unleash a deadly virus.

programme.title: Starman
programme.desc: (1984) John Carpenter's sci-fi romance with Jeff Bridges and Karen Allen. An alien is stranded on Earth, where he assumes the form of a widow's dead husband - and finds the locals hostile.

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: (2008) Remake of the sci-fi classic with Keanu Reeves. An alien visits Earth to tell humankind to stop destroying the planet. But when he's attacked, he decides to eradicate us instead...

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
programme.desc: (2018) Tom Cruise stars in part six of the action-thriller series. His mission: to stop terrorists from getting their hands on nuclear bombs and unleashing global devastation.

programme.title: The Lighthouse
programme.desc: (2019) Oscar-nominated psychological horror starring Willem Dafoe and Robert Pattinson. A pair of lighthouse keepers dangerously descend into insanity on a remote island.

programme.title: The Double
programme.desc: (2013) Dark psychological thriller. Jesse Eisenberg stars as a timid man whose drab existence takes a turn for the worse with the arrival of a new colleague at work. With Chris Morris.

programme.desc: (1956) Sci-fi thriller. Hugh Marlowe stars as a scientist who discovers Earth is threatened by a fleet of flying saucers bent on global conquest. With special effects by Ray Harryhausen.

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: Romantic drama starring Patrick Swayze, Demi Moore and Whoopi Goldberg. Sam's troubled spirit refuses to leave Molly and he becomes her ghostly guardian, but how can he warn her that her life is in danger?

programme.title: My National Gallery
programme.desc: The stories of people whose lives have been touched by the art museum in Trafalgar Square, from security guards to directors, and everyday visitors to celebrities and members of the royal family. Claudia Winkleman, Michael Palin, Terry Gilliam, Jacqueline Wilson and Princess Eugenie are among those revealing personal connections with the National Gallery, with each contributor identifying the one artwork that means the most to them, with this diverse cross-section of society making surprising choices of both well-known masterpieces and hidden gems

programme.title: Love Your Friday with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Continuing his stroll down memory lane, Alan revisits a 2020 episode of Love Your Weekend with interviews with comedian Hugh Dennis and TV star Lesley Joseph. Plus, there's a trip to an allotment in Ilkley which is where the host grew up

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as Kelly-Anne and Craig from Greenock, Kent couple Paul and Catharine, and husband-and-wife team Daniel and Hind from London use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as a contestant tries to open the 22 red boxes in the right order, taking on the infamous Banker for the chance to win a life-changing cash prize

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: All that stands between Tom from Oxford, Yasmin from Surrey, Mercedes from Blackpool and Gary from Wigan and thousands of pounds is the matter of one of the country's finest quiz brains. Bradley Walsh asks the questions, but do they have the answers?

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chas wants to get to the bottom of Ruby's behaviour, Jacob is stressed, while Marlon and Rhona are at each other's throats

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Mason takes a risk to help Lisa to apprehend his brothers, Evelyn encounters a familiar face at her university interview, and Daisy decides to cut ties with Bertie. Tracy accuses Cassie of swindling Ken, and Carla learns that her kidney has been damaged by sepsis

programme.title: Vera, Farewell Pet
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes to examine the appeal of ITV detective drama Vera as it comes to an end after 13 years. Brenda Blethyn reflects on her time as DCI Vera Stanhope, and talks about the camaraderie and joy of working on the show. Featuring interviews from key cast members - David Leon (DS Joe Ashworth), Jon Morrison (DC Kenny Lockhart), the directors, crew, and author Ann Cleeves, Vera's creator

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Period crime drama starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. The Midwest in the 1930s: when the profession of ruthless hitman Michael Sullivan is discovered, a killer is sent to eradicate him and his family. But Sullivan and his 12-year-old son escape and embark upon a life-changing journey of revenge.

programme.title: Archie
programme.desc: Cary overcomes his fears and phobias and ties the knot for a fourth time with Dyan Cannon and they are soon thrilled with the arrival of his first child Jennifer in 1966. But at 62, Cary struggles with the responsibilities of being a parent after an all-too-short honeymoon period and becomes controlling again

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Love Your Friday with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Continuing his stroll down memory lane, Alan revisits a 2020 episode of Love Your Weekend with interviews with comedian Hugh Dennis and TV star Lesley Joseph. Plus, there's a trip to an allotment in Ilkley which is where the host grew up

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of three factories in Yorkshire. It reveals how Aunt Bessie's produces millions of Yorkshire puddings a year, how Yorkshire Tea turn out teabags by the truckload and how Birds Eye workers face a race against time to get their peas from field to freezer. Narrated by Siobhan Finneran

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm at Christmas
programme.desc: Kelvin, Liz and the family head to Finland for a seasonal special, visiting a family farm thriving in the harsh conditions of the Arctic Circle. The Fletchers dive into the magic of a Nordic winter by enjoying traditional activities and meeting the animals that flourish in this frosty wilderness to make their Finnish adventure one the family will never forget

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are actress Sophie Thompson, and TV presenter JJ Chalmers, who talks about his friendship with the Duke of Sussex. Plus, horticulturalist Camilla Bassett Smith opens her January diary, and Aleesha Hansell discusses the British white wines causing a stir

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James welcomes in 2025 by serving up a feast of delicious recipes for broadcaster Gloria Hunniford and enjoying dishes from fellow chefs Galton Blackiston and Tommy Banks

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott return with more recipes, beginning by exploring the flavours of the Middle East, starting with chicken torsh, a traditional sweet and sour Persian kebab. Lisa Snowdon pays a visit to Nilly's Turkish to find out what makes her wraps so popular, before cooking up her own dish inspired by the flavours she finds. Back in the kitchen, Ainsley is joined by Kate Lawler, who whips up a mega salad and has a secret halloumi hack

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits the Languedoc region, famous for its wine and the hearty, meaty dish cassoulet, and stops at a roadside fruit stall owned by a couple of British expats, before creating an unusual dish using melon and onion rings. He meets a modest chef who prepares a mouth-watering cassoulet, before staying at an 18th-century coach house and visiting a museum dedicated to Citroen 2CVs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Veterans' Chase at Sandown Park, plus racing from Wincanton. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Leonna Mayor, reports by Alice Plunkett and Oli Bell, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Julia Goulding, Oz Clarke, Laura Hamilton and Mr Motivator pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton returns with the game show in which contestants compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes, with accountant John, primary school teacher Jess and care home assistant Paris trying to win a potential jackpot of £50,000

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett is back with the singing contest in which the celebrity panel must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Returning panellists Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan are joined by Maya Jama, and this opening episode sees the first six of the 12 mystery celebrities battling it out as Teeth, Snail, Tattoo, Kingfisher, Spag Bol and Dressed Crab take to the stage

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Return of the quiz hosted by the duo in which contestants get the chance to win the biggest cash prize in British TV history with a limitless jackpot. First up are Joe and sister-in-law Jo, who have been prepping by going round the supermarket sizing things up with a tape measure, followed by Steve and son-in-law Jordan, who hope their approach will help propel them into the truly life-changing sums of money on the ladder

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: The death of 19-year-old Sophie Chalcott, the daughter of the UK minister for trade, sparks international interest after her body is found floating in Sydney harbour the morning after a lavish party on a boat. British detective Max Drummond arrives in Sydney to find a complex homicide investigation under way and clashes immediately with DS Meg Driscoll on her first murder case as lead detective. Thriller, starring John Bradley, Joanne Froggatt and Kirsty Sturgess

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Blackburn Rovers v Burnley at Ewood Park, Hull City v Leeds United at MKM Stadium and Watford v Sheffield United at Vicarage Road in the Championship

British detective Max Drummond arrives in Sydney to find a complex homicide investigation under way and clashes immediately with DS Meg Driscoll on her first murder case as lead detective. Thriller, starring John Bradley, Joanne Froggatt and Kirsty Sturgess

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: Romantic drama starring Patrick Swayze, Demi Moore and Whoopi Goldberg. Soon after swearing his undying love to girlfriend Molly Jensen, investment banker Sam Wheat is killed by a mugger. Sam's troubled spirit refuses to leave Molly and he becomes her ghostly guardian, but how can he warn her that her life is in danger?

programme.title: My National Gallery
programme.desc: The stories of people whose lives have been touched by the art museum in Trafalgar Square, from security guards to directors, and everyday visitors to celebrities and members of the royal family. Claudia Winkleman, Michael Palin, Terry Gilliam, Jacqueline Wilson and Princess Eugenie are among those revealing personal connections with the National Gallery, with each contributor identifying the one artwork that means the most to them, with this diverse cross-section of society making surprising choices of both well-known masterpieces and hidden gems

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chas wants to get to the bottom of Ruby's behaviour, Jacob is stressed, while Marlon and Rhona are at each other's throats

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Mason takes a risk to help Lisa to apprehend his brothers, Evelyn encounters a familiar face at her university interview, and Daisy decides to cut ties with Bertie. Tracy accuses Cassie of swindling Ken, and Carla learns that her kidney has been damaged by sepsis

programme.title: Vera, Farewell Pet
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes to examine the appeal of ITV detective drama Vera as it comes to an end after 13 years. Brenda Blethyn reflects on her time as DCI Vera Stanhope, and talks about the camaraderie and joy of working on the show. Featuring interviews from key cast members - David Leon (DS Joe Ashworth), Jon Morrison (DC Kenny Lockhart), the directors, crew, and author Ann Cleeves, Vera's creator

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Period crime drama starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. The Midwest in the 1930s: when the profession of ruthless hitman Michael Sullivan is discovered, a killer is sent to eradicate him and his family. But Sullivan and his 12-year-old son escape and embark upon a life-changing journey of revenge.

programme.title: Archie
programme.desc: Cary overcomes his fears and phobias and ties the knot for a fourth time with Dyan Cannon and they are soon thrilled with the arrival of his first child Jennifer in 1966. But at 62, Cary struggles with the responsibilities of being a parent after an all-too-short honeymoon period and becomes controlling again

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Love Your Friday with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Continuing his stroll down memory lane, Alan revisits a 2020 episode of Love Your Weekend with interviews with comedian Hugh Dennis and TV star Lesley Joseph. Plus, there's a trip to an allotment in Ilkley which is where the host grew up

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of three factories in Yorkshire. It reveals how Aunt Bessie's produces millions of Yorkshire puddings a year, how Yorkshire Tea turn out teabags by the truckload and how Birds Eye workers face a race against time to get their peas from field to freezer. Narrated by Siobhan Finneran

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm at Christmas
programme.desc: Kelvin, Liz and the family head to Finland for a seasonal special, visiting a family farm thriving in the harsh conditions of the Arctic Circle. The Fletchers dive into the magic of a Nordic winter by enjoying traditional activities and meeting the animals that flourish in this frosty wilderness to make their Finnish adventure one the family will never forget

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are actress Sophie Thompson, and TV presenter JJ Chalmers, who talks about his friendship with the Duke of Sussex. Plus, horticulturalist Camilla Bassett Smith opens her January diary, and Aleesha Hansell discusses the British white wines causing a stir

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James welcomes in 2025 by serving up a feast of delicious recipes for broadcaster Gloria Hunniford and enjoying dishes from fellow chefs Galton Blackiston and Tommy Banks

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott return with more recipes, beginning by exploring the flavours of the Middle East, starting with chicken torsh, a traditional sweet and sour Persian kebab. Lisa Snowdon pays a visit to Nilly's Turkish to find out what makes her wraps so popular, before cooking up her own dish inspired by the flavours she finds. Back in the kitchen, Ainsley is joined by Kate Lawler, who whips up a mega salad and has a secret halloumi hack

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits the Languedoc region, famous for its wine and the hearty, meaty dish cassoulet, and stops at a roadside fruit stall owned by a couple of British expats, before creating an unusual dish using melon and onion rings. He meets a modest chef who prepares a mouth-watering cassoulet, before staying at an 18th-century coach house and visiting a museum dedicated to Citroen 2CVs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Veterans' Chase at Sandown Park, plus racing from Wincanton. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Leonna Mayor, reports by Alice Plunkett and Oli Bell, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Julia Goulding, Oz Clarke, Laura Hamilton and Mr Motivator pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton returns with the game show in which contestants compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes, with accountant John, primary school teacher Jess and care home assistant Paris trying to win a potential jackpot of £50,000

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett is back with the singing contest in which the celebrity panel must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Returning panellists Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan are joined by Maya Jama, and this opening episode sees the first six of the 12 mystery celebrities battling it out as Teeth, Snail, Tattoo, Kingfisher, Spag Bol and Dressed Crab take to the stage

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Return of the quiz hosted by the duo in which contestants get the chance to win the biggest cash prize in British TV history with a limitless jackpot. First up are Joe and sister-in-law Jo, who have been prepping by going round the supermarket sizing things up with a tape measure, followed by Steve and son-in-law Jordan, who hope their approach will help propel them into the truly life-changing sums of money on the ladder

The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.desc: Zermatt to Geneva: Michael Portillo travels from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught in a war zone with the Red Cross and rescued from an 'avalanche'.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Ham House 1: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Ham House in the London borough of Richmond-upon-Thames, where an 18th-century robe could be an important piece of Chinese history.

programme.desc: Dyffryn Gardens 1: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Dyffryn Gardens near Cardiff, where items include a necklace made from large pieces of Baltic amber.

programme.desc: Shopping from Home.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh 1: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the Royal Botanic Garden in Edinburgh. Items brought in to be valued include rare Russian jewels.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Aston Hall 1: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Aston Hall in Birmingham, and is joined by poet Benjamin Zephaniah, who has fond childhood memories of playing in the grounds.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Villa De Vecchi Rhodes: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Pyramiden Norway: A town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Genocide: How did Heinrich Himmler plan to realise Hitler's vision of a pure Aryan Germany? Actor Laurence Olivier explains as he narrates the acclaimed documentary series about WWII.

programme.title: WW2 - Frontlines
programme.desc: Berlin: April 1945, Berlin - the last savage chapter in the Battle for Europe. Stalin's generals compete to avenge the Nazis assault in the East and raise the Red Flag over the Reichstag.
